title: 103_s2145
content:
The "Agricultural Mediation Act of 1994" may be cited as the short title for this Act. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The "Agricultural Mediation Act of 1994" defines key terms such as agricultural mediation program, Department, eligible department program, mediation, and Secretary. The term "Secretary" in the "Agricultural Mediation Act of 1994" refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Agricultural Mediation Act of 1994 authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to determine eligible Department programs for mediation, considering program complexity, participant interests, and fairness in dispute resolution. States can be certified to administer mediation for these programs. SEC. 5. Notice of eligible Department programs and solicitation for States to apply for certification to administer agricultural mediation programs. SEC. 6. Certification of States to administer agricultural mediation programs. To administer an agricultural mediation program, a State must be certified by the Secretary based on meeting specific requirements. The State must demonstrate the need for the program based on agricultural activity and participants involved. The agricultural mediation program must ensure mediation services for eligible participants, be administered by the State, train mediators, maintain confidentiality, and notify Department entities affected by the program. SEC. 7. RECERTIFICATION.

To maintain certification for an agricultural mediation program, a State must recertify the program as directed by the Secretary and provide necessary information on mediated disputes to Department agencies while adhering to confidentiality laws. The Secretary will make this information available to the public.

SEC. 8. MATCHING GRANTS TO STATES. SEC. 8. MATCHING GRANTS TO STATES.

The Secretary will provide matching grants to States for agricultural mediation program administration. States can receive up to 70% of program costs. The funds must be used solely for program operation. Non-compliance may result in ineligibility for future grants. SEC. 9. ADMINISTRATION.

The Secretary will provide relevant information or analysis upon request for mediated disputes. The Secretary must participate in agricultural mediation programs. The Secretary is not bound by decisions from mediation if not agreed upon.

SEC. 10. REGULATIONS.

Regulations to implement this Act must be issued within 120 days of enactment.

SEC. 11. CONSTRUCTION. SEC. 11. CONSTRUCTION. The authority provided by this Act is additional to the authority under the Agricultural Credit Act of 1987. SEC. 12. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amendments to Farm Credit Act and Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act regarding mediation rights by borrowers. SEC. 13. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Authorization of appropriations for the Act is set at $7,500,000 for fiscal years 1995 through 1998. The Act's authority will terminate on September 30, 1998. The Act and its amendments will be effective upon enactment, with a transitional provision for states already certified for agricultural loan mediation programs.
